I want you to keep following us on Blacksit.  And as I said, I'll be sharing about our journey.  I read a lot of your comments.  And I really wanted to talk about why we came to Africa from the diaspora.  And I've got two brothers with me who also are from England and... Our Lords.  Our Lords.  Who basically come via England, let's just say that much.  Let's say we came via England.  And who are here with me. So I'd like to introduce you to Michael.
Come on, Michael.

She's a very nice person with her husband, Adrian.  But anyway, to cut a long story short, I've been in Gambia for about 15 years now.  I do so many different things.  Renewable energy.
I just came back from Sierra Leone, which is where I was born.

and to implement renewable energy.  Energy is very important in Africa.  So, you know, for people like us coming in, as Judith said, it's good to bring these technologies into Africa rather than expecting the Chinese and the Indians to keep bringing the obsolete equipment and think that they're blessing us.  So we do our own thing and we bring the best for Africa because if it's good for the rest of the world, then it should be good for Africa.  So that's one of the things we do.  I do property development, so I build.  I've got my sports academy here.  I'm the president of WPU Africa, which is the World Boxing Union.  I started the All African Boxing Board of Control, so now there's a legal entity for African boxers to have professional boxing license to fight all over the world.  And amongst other things.  So it's been an amazing journey.  I'm in and out all the time, but Africa's always been home.  Going back to Syria last week was very emotional.  And yeah, we love it.
You know, there's a...

Africa's in our heart, and when you're in Africa, you know that there is a connection.  There's something that sometimes you can't even fully explain, but you know there's a peace of mind that you get when you're in Africa.  So the journey continues, I guess.  Wow, excellent.
